snippet: Cleveland and Philadelphia are preparing for the possibility that anger may spill into the streets during the Republican and Democratic gatherings.
abstract: As many as 6,000 protesters from coalition of dozens of groups plan on demonstrating in Cleveland when Republicans arrive for Republican National Convention; large number of supporters of Sen Bernie Sanders plan to protest at Democratic National Convention in Philadelphia, as well; cities say they are well-prepared, and that modern policing practices are likely to decrease chance of violence.
lead_paragraph: Cleveland and Philadelphia are preparing for the possibility that anger may spill into the streets during the Republican and Democratic gatherings.

headline.main: Will Dominant Images of Conventions Be of Unity or Protest?
headline.print_headline: As Resentment Keeps Swirling, Parties’ Convention Cities Brace for Protests
